required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of SPD503 in Combination With Psychostimulants
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Multi-Center, Dose Optimization Study Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of SPD503 in Combination With Psychostimulants in Children and Adolescents Aged 6-17 Years With a Diagnosis of Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy and safety of SPD503 in subjects with ADHD when co-administered with psychostimulants in children and adolescents aged 6-17 years with a diagnosis of ADHD with a sub-optimal, partial response to stimulants.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-fourth Edition (ADHD-RS-IV) Total Score at Week 8 - Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and weekly up to 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The ADHD-RS-IV consists of 18 items scored on a 4-point scale ranging from 0 (no symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms) with total score ranging from 0 to 54.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Improvement on Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) at Week 8 - LOCF
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and weekly up to 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Clinical Global Impression-Severity of Illness (CGI-S) at Week 8 - LOCF
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and weekly up to 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Conners' Global Index - Parent (CGI-P) Total Score at Week 8 - LOCF: Morning Assessment (Before School)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and weekly up to 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The index contains 10 items. Each item on the scale is scored from a range of 0 (reflecting never, seldom) to 3 (reflecting very often, very frequent) with total scores ranging from 0 to 30.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Conners' Global Index - Parent (CGI-P) Total Score at Week 8 - LOCF: Evening Assessment (Before Bedtime)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and weekly up to 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The index contains 10 items. Each item on the scale is scored from a range of 0 (reflecting never, seldom) to 3 (reflecting very often, very frequent) with total scores ranging from 0 30.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Improvement on Parent Global Assessment (PGA) at Week 8 - LOCF
secondary_outcome.description: Parent Global Assessment (PGA) consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Oppositional Subscale of the Conners' Parent Rating Scale-Revised Long Form (CPRS-R:L) Score at Week 8 - LOCF
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and weekly up to 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The oppositional subscale of the CPRS-R:L contains 10 items designed to reflect criteria for oppositional defiance disorder (ODD). Each item is scored on a range from 0 (not true at all) to 3 (very much true) with total scores ranging from 0 to 30. Higher scores are reflective of more severe symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Before School Functioning Questionnaire (BSFQ) at Week 8 - LOCF
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and weekly up to 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: This scale was designed to assess symptoms of ADHD that typically occur in the morning. The BSFQ consists of two components. The first, a 20-item scale with ratings from 0 (none) to 3 (severe) with a range of 0-60 followed by two questions answered with duration of time (in minutes). The second, a 14-item scale with ratings from 0 (no) to 2 (a lot) with a range of 0-28. The results reported here are from the 20-item scale. Lower scores are better.

secondary_outcome.measure: Post Sleep Questionnaire (PSQ) Quality of Sleep at Week 8 - LOCF
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and weekly up to 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Post Sleep Questionnaire (PSQ) overall rating of quality of sleep. There are 5 rating responses ranging from very poor to very good. No numbers are associated with the rating responses.

intervention.description: Placebo matched to Guanfacine Hydrochloride Extended Release

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy subjects with ADHD currently taking a stable dose of psychostimulant for at least 4 weeks
- Aged 6-17 years with a sub-optimal
- Partial response to stimulants
- Subjects must be < 95th percentile for BMI with weight >= 55lbs and <= 176lbs

facility.name: Midwest Research Group/St. Charles Psychiatric Associates
Centers for Psychiatry and Behavioral Medicine
Duke University Medical Center ADHD Program
Department of Psychiatry, The Ohio State University
Oregon Center for Clinical Investigations, Inc
Oregon Center for Clinical Investigations, INC (OCCI, Inc.)
Oregon Center for Clinical Investigations, Inc
Psychiatric Alliance of the Blue Ridge Clinical Research

results_reference.citation: Wilens TE, Bukstein O, Brams M, Cutler AJ, Childress A, Rugino T, Lyne A, Grannis K, Youcha S. A controlled trial of extended-release guanfacine and psychostimulants for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder. J Am Acad Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 2012 Jan;51(1):74-85.e2. doi: 10.1016/j.jaac.2011.10.012. Epub 2011 Nov 25.

group.title: SPD503-AM + Psychostimulant
group.description: Guanfacine Hydrochloride Extended Release administered in the AM plus a psychostimulant (subject was on a stable dose on entry and maintained throughout) administered each morning. This group received a matching placebo in the PM. An optimal dose of Guanfacine Hydrochloride Extended Release (1-4 mg/day once-daily) is determined for each subject over 5 weeks. The subject is then maintained on this optimal dose for an additional 3 weeks.

group.title: SPD503-PM + Psychostimulant
group.description: Guanfacine Hydrochloride Extended Release administered in the PM plus a psychostimulant (subject was on a stable dose on entry and maintained throughout) administered each morning. This group received a matching placebo in the AM. An optimal dose of Guanfacine Hydrochloride Extended Release (1-4 mg/day once-daily) is determined for each subject over 5 weeks. The subject is then maintained on this optimal dose for an additional 3 weeks.

group.title: Placebo + Psychostimulant
group.description: Placebo was administered in both the AM and PM plus a psychostimulant (subject was on a stable dose on entry and maintained throughout) each morning.

group.title: SPD503-AM + Psychostimulant
group.description: Guanfacine Hydrochloride Extended Release administered in the AM plus a psychostimulant (subject was on a stable dose on entry and maintained throughout) administered each morning. This group received a matching placebo in the PM. An optimal dose of Guanfacine Hydrochloride Extended Release (1-4 mg/day once-daily) is determined for each subject over 5 weeks. The subject is then maintained on this optimal dose for an additional 3 weeks.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-fourth Edition (ADHD-RS-IV) Total Score at Week 8 - Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)
outcome.description: The ADHD-RS-IV consists of 18 items scored on a 4-point scale ranging from 0 (no symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms) with total score ranging from 0 to 54.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and weekly up to 8 weeks
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) which includes all subjects who received at least 1 dose of any study drug during this study.

The subject is then maintained on this optimal dose for an additional 3 weeks.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-fourth Edition (ADHD-RS-IV) Total Score at Week 8 - Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)
measure.description: The ADHD-RS-IV consists of 18 items scored on a 4-point scale ranging from 0 (no symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms) with total score ranging from 0 to 54.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) which includes all subjects who received at least 1 dose of any study drug during this study.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis stated that there was no difference between SPD503 AM or placebo and that there was no difference between SPD503 PM or placebo. 90% power was needed to detect an effect size of at least 0.4 between either SPD503 group and placebo.
analysis.p_value_desc: Both SPD503 groups were compared with placebo using Dunnett's adjustment. Each treatment comparison was evaluated at the 0.05 significance level (Dunnett's adjusted).

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis stated that there was no difference between SPD503 AM or placebo and that there was no difference between SPD503 PM or placebo. 90% power was needed to detect an effect size of at least 0.4 between either SPD503 group and placebo.
analysis.p_value_desc: Both SPD503 groups were compared with placebo using Dunnett's adjustment. Each treatment comparison was evaluated at the 0.05 significance level (Dunnett's adjusted).

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Before School Functioning Questionnaire (BSFQ) at Week 8 - LOCF
outcome.description: This scale was designed to assess symptoms of ADHD that typically occur in the morning. The BSFQ consists of two components. The first, a 20-item scale with ratings from 0 (none) to 3 (severe) with a range of 0-60 followed by two questions answered with duration of time (in minutes). The second, a 14-item scale with ratings from 0 (no) to 2 (a lot) with a range of 0-28. The results reported here are from the 20-item scale. Lower scores are better.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and weekly up to 8 weeks

reported_events.desc: For the serious adverse events: syncope occurred in the context of nausea, vomiting and sinusitis; self-injurious behavior, aggression, homicidal ideation, and adjustment disorder with mixed disturbance of emotions and conduct in a subject with similar behaviors prior to study start; exposure to toxic agent was poison ivy.

group.title: SPD503-AM + Psychostimulant
group.description: Guanfacine Hydrochloride Extended Release administered in the AM plus a psychostimulant (subject was on a stable dose on entry and maintained throughout) administered each morning. This group received a matching placebo in the PM. An optimal dose of Guanfacine Hydrochloride Extended Release (1-4 mg/day once-daily) is determined for each subject over 5 weeks. The subject is then maintained on this optimal dose for an additional 3 weeks.

The subject is then maintained on this optimal dose for an additional 3 weeks.

event.sub_title: Adjustment disorder with mixed disturbance of emotion and conduct

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a multicenter publication is not submitted within twelve (12) months after conclusion, abandonment or termination of the Study at all sites, or after Sponsor confirms there shall be no multicenter Study publication, the Institution and/or such Principal Investigator may publish the results from the Institution site individually.
